{
  description = "Hugo Development Environment";
  
  inputs = {
    nixpkgs.url = "github:NixOS/nixpkgs/nixpkgs-unstable";
  };
  
  outputs = { self, nixpkgs }: {
    devShells.default = pkgs.mkShell {

  };
}

item.title: About
item.description:
About This Blog

Welcome to Jesse’s Blog! This is a personal space where I share my thoughts, experiences, and learnings.

Using Obsidian with Hugo

This blog is powered by Hugo with the PaperMod theme. I write my content using Obsidian, a powerful knowledge management tool, and then publish it to this Hugo site.

Contact

Feel free to reach out to me through GitHub or other social platforms.

item.title: å†™ä½œè§„èŒƒä¸å‘½åè§„èŒƒ
item.description: åšå®¢å†™ä½œä¸æ–‡ä»¶å‘½åè§„èŒƒï¼ŒåŒ…å«åŒé“¾ç¬”è®°çš„ä½¿ç”¨æŒ‡å—

Add relevant emojis to enhance {}. Follow these rules: 1. Insert emojis at natural breaks in the text 2. Never place two emojis next to each other 3. Keep all original text unchanged 4. Choose emojis that match the context and tone Return only the emojified text.
Explain {} in simple terms that a 5-year-old would understand: 1. Use basic vocabulary 2. Include simple analogies 3. Break down complex concepts Return only the simplified explanation.
Fix the grammar and spelling of {}. Preserve all formatting, line breaks, and special characters. Do not add or remove any content. Return only the corrected text.
Create a glossary of important terms, concepts, and phrases from {}. Format each entry as “Term: Definition”. Sort entries alphabetically. Return only the glossary.
Generate a hierarchical table of contents for {}. Use appropriate heading levels (H1, H2, H3, etc.). Include page numbers if present. Return only the table of contents.
Expand {} to twice its length by: 1. Adding relevant details and examples 2. Elaborating on key points 3. Maintaining the original tone and style Return only the expanded text.
Reduce {} to half its length while preserving these elements: 1. Main ideas and key points 2. Essential details 3. Original tone and style Return only the shortened text.
Remove all URLs from {}. Preserve all other content and formatting. URLs may be in various formats (http, https, www). Return only the text with URLs removed.

Convert {} into a Twitter thread following these rules: 1. Each tweet must be under 240 characters 2. Start with “THREAD START” on its own line 3. Separate tweets with "

" 4. End with “THREAD END” on its own line 5. Make content engaging and clear Return only the formatted thread.
Rewrite {} as a single tweet with these requirements: 1. Maximum 280 characters 2. Use concise, impactful language 3. Maintain the core message Return only the tweet text.
Simplify {} to a 6th-grade reading level (ages 11-12). Use simple sentences, common words, and clear explanations. Maintain the original key concepts. Return only the simplified text.
Create a bullet-point summary of {}. Each bullet point should capture a key point. Return only the bullet-point summary.
Translate {} into Chinese: 1. Preserve the meaning and tone 2. Maintain appropriate cultural context 3. Keep formatting and structure Return only the translated text.

# Linux ä¸ Windows åŠ¨æ€åº“æœºåˆ¶å¯¹æ¯”ï¼šä»äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ ¼å¼åˆ°åŠ è½½æµç¨‹

å³ä½¿ Linux å’Œ Windows çš„å†…æ ¸å¤§å¤šä½¿ç”¨ C è¯­è¨€ç¼–å†™ï¼Œå®ƒä»¬çš„åŠ¨æ€é“¾æ¥åº“å´åˆ†åˆ«é‡‡ç”¨ `.so`ï¼ˆShared Objectï¼‰å’Œ `.dll`ï¼ˆDynamic-Link Libraryï¼‰æ ¼å¼ã€‚è¿™ç§å·®å¼‚å¹¶éå¶ç„¶ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯ç”±æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿåº•å±‚çš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ ¼å¼ã€ABIï¼ˆApplication Binary Interfaceï¼‰ã€åŠ è½½æœºåˆ¶å’Œå†å²æ¼”è¿›è·¯å¾„å…±åŒå†³å®šçš„ã€‚æœ¬æ–‡å°†ç³»ç»Ÿæ€§åœ°å¯¹æ¯”ä¸¤è€…çš„å¼‚åŒï¼Œå¹¶è¯¦ç»†è§£æä»ç¨‹åºå¯åŠ¨åˆ°åŠ¨æ€åº“åŠ è½½è¿è¡Œçš„å…¨è¿‡ç¨‹ã€‚

## ğŸ“‹ ç›®å½•

## æ ¸å¿ƒå‰æï¼šC è¯­è¨€ â‰  äºŒè¿›åˆ¶å…¼å®¹

C è¯­è¨€æ˜¯ä¸€ç§é«˜çº§æºç è¯­è¨€ï¼Œå…¶ç¼–è¯‘åçš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶è¡¨ç°å½¢å¼å®Œå…¨å–å†³äºç›®æ ‡å¹³å°ã€‚å³ä½¿ç›¸åŒçš„ C æºç ï¼Œåœ¨ Linux å’Œ Windows ä¸Šç¼–è¯‘åï¼š
- ç”Ÿæˆçš„**ç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶æ ¼å¼ä¸åŒ**ï¼ˆELF vs PEï¼‰
- **å‡½æ•°è°ƒç”¨çº¦å®š**ä¸åŒï¼ˆå¦‚ `cdecl` vs `stdcall`ï¼‰
- **ç¬¦å·ä¿®é¥°ä¸å¯¼å‡ºæœºåˆ¶**ä¸åŒ
- **å†…å­˜å¸ƒå±€ä¸é‡å®šä½æ–¹å¼**ä¸åŒ

å› æ­¤ï¼Œ**â€œç”¨ C ç¼–å†™â€ä»…è¯´æ˜å®ç°è¯­è¨€ï¼Œä¸å†³å®šäºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ¥å£æ ‡å‡†**ã€‚æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿå¿…é¡»å®šä¹‰è‡ªå·±çš„ ABI å’ŒåŠ è½½æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œä»¥ç¡®ä¿ç¨³å®šæ€§ã€å®‰å…¨æ€§å’Œæ€§èƒ½ã€‚

---

## äºŒè¿›åˆ¶æ ¼å¼å¯¹æ¯”ï¼šELF vs PE

| ç»´åº¦ | Linuxï¼ˆELFï¼‰ | Windowsï¼ˆPEï¼‰ |
|------|-------------|---------------|
| **å…¨ç§°** | Executable and Linkable Format | Portable Executable |
| **åŠ¨æ€åº“æ‰©å±•å** | `.so` | `.dll` |
| **å¯æ‰§è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶æ ‡è¯†** | ELF Magic: `7F 45 4C 46` | DOS + PE å¤´: `"MZ"` + `"PE\0\0"` |
| **å…³é”®æ®µ/èŠ‚** | `.text`, `.data`, `.dynamic`, `.dynsym`, `.got`, `.plt` | `.text`, `.data`, `.rdata`, `Import Table`, `Export Table`, `.reloc` |
| **åŠ¨æ€é“¾æ¥å…ƒæ•°æ®** | `.dynamic` æ®µ + `PT_INTERP` ç¨‹åºå¤´ | DataDirectory ä¸­çš„ Import/Export è¡¨ |

ELF æ˜¯ POSIX ç³»ç»Ÿçš„äº‹å®æ ‡å‡†ï¼Œè€Œ PE æ˜¯ Microsoft ä¸º Windows å®šä¹‰çš„ç§æœ‰æ ¼å¼ã€‚ä¸¤è€…åœ¨ç»“æ„è®¾è®¡ä¸ŠæœåŠ¡äºä¸åŒçš„ OS æ¨¡å‹ï¼Œå› æ­¤**æ— æ³•äº’æ“ä½œ**ã€‚
